description: A taste of the Caribbean with a difference in this lime and lemongrass rum punch recipe – simple to make, perfect for lazy summer afternoons.
ingredients: 2 lemongrass stalks, roughly chopped, plus extra stalks to decorate
Juice of 3 limes, plus 1 lime, thinly sliced

method.Step 1: Put the sugar, lemongrass and 200ml cold water in a small pan and heat gently, stirring until the sugar dissolves. Cool then strain into a large jug. Stir in the lime juice and rum, and top up with soda. Chill until ready to serve.

method.Step 2: Decorate with extra lemongrass stalks. Fill 6 glasses with ice and slices of lime. Pour over the rum punch and enjoy.

title: Prosecco Royale cocktail
description: Based on a classic Kir Royale, this Prosecco and crème de cassis cocktail is the perfect party tipple.

method.Step 1: Pour ½ tsp of crème de cassis into 6 tall champagne flutes and top up with chilled Prosecco.

method.Step 2: Serve as an apéritif with the Stilton and sesame biscuits.

title: Homemade limoncello
time: Takes 10 min to make, plus 2 weeks’ infusing, 10 days’ macerating and freezing
description: Want to make your own limoncello? Then here’s how – get ready to delight a loved one by giving it as a gift or keep it in the freezer for impromptu after-dinner digestif. It needs a few weeks to macerate and infuse, so make sure you start it in good time.

method.Step 1: Wash the lemons well. Peel the zest from the lemons with a potato peeler, taking care not to remove any of the white pith underneath. Place the zest in a large sterilised screw-top or clip-top jar and cover with half the vodka. Seal and set aside for 2 weeks.

method.Step 2: Two weeks later, put 225ml water and the sugar together in a saucepan over a low heat until the sugar has completely dissolved. Leave the sugar syrup to cool completely. (This is very important because if the sugar syrup is warm it will produce a cloudy limoncello.)

method.Step 3: Pass the lemon-infused vodka through a very fine or muslin-lined sieve into a jug and mix with the remaining vodka and the sugar syrup. Pour the mixture into a sterilised bottle and seal tightly with a cork or airtight lid. Set aside in a dark cool place for 10 days, for the flavours to develop.

method.Step 4: To serve as a liqueur, chill in the freezer for several hours before drinking.

title: Hot marmalade rum cocktail
description: The writer Michael van Straten is an expert on complementary medicine and well known for his healthy drinks recipes. This warm cocktail has been adapted from his lovely idea for a marmalade tea, adding dark rum to imbue an extra warm glow.

method.Step 1: Put the grated ginger into a jug or infuser and fill with boiling water. Leave for 5 minutes, then strain into a mug. (Warm up again in the microwave if necessary.)

method.Step 2: Add the marmalade and stir until dissolved. Add the dark rum, stir and drink while hot.

title: Apple tea hot toddy
description: You can make this hot toddy recipe with ordinary brandy but calvados adds a lovely apply depth to the drink.
ingredients: Mug of freshly made medium-strength black tea

method.Step 1: Make the tea. While it is brewing, pour the shot of calvados into a tall glass tumbler. Squeeze in the lemon, add the honey and cloves, and top up with the hot tea to taste.

title: Ginger hot toddy
description: Ginger is not only warming and peppery – in this hot toddy recipe – but it’s also deeply soothing. We use ginger wine in our hot cocktail for the ultimate winter warmer.

method.Step 1: Put the ginger wine and brandy into a small pan. Add a drop or two of the cream and stir well. Warm through gently – don’t bring to simmering point (see tips).

method.Step 2: Remove from the heat, allow to cool for 1 minute, then pour into a glass. Grate some nutmeg over the top.

title: Spiced berry hot toddy
description: A hybrid between mulled wine and a hot toddy, this is a deeply warming, non-alcoholic cocktail (although you can add a little port and brandy if you want to pep it up a little).
ingredients: 10ml Bottlegreen Spiced Berry cordial, or similar

method.Step 1: Mix the berry cordial with 80 ml very hot water, then heat in a pan until just below simmering point.

method.Step 2: Add the spices and ginger and brew for a couple of minutes. Pour into a mug and drink piping hot.

title: Classic hot toddy
description: Nothing can warm you and lift your spirits in the depths of winter like a hot toddy. The warm whisky cocktail is so soothing, some use it for medicinal purposes; it’s a great decongestant.

method.Step 1: Pour the whiskey into a thick glass tumbler, add the cloves and stir. Top up with very hot – but not boiling – water, to taste.

method.Step 2: Add a lemon slice, or two, then stir in the sugar. Drink while very warm, inhaling the steam.

title: Irish coffee with Baileys cream
description: This Irish coffee recipe uses Baileys, and puts a modern twist on a classic dessert drink. It has rich aromas of vanilla balancing the bite of quality Irish whiskey…

method.Step 1: Whip the cream with the sugar, vanilla seeds and Baileys, until thick but not stiff.

method.Step 2: Put a metal teaspoon into each serving glass and fill with boiling water. Leave for a few minutes to warm the glasses. Make up the fresh coffee.

method.Step 3: Pour away the water and add a measure of Irish whiskey and 1 teaspoon dark muscovado sugar to each glass. Fill just over three-quarters full with the coffee and stir. Spoon the cream over the back of another spoon straight onto the hot coffee to give a thick layer.

title: Blackberry gin
time: Takes 35 minutes to make, plus sterilising bottles and chilling
description: Looking for an alternative to a sloe gin? This blackberry gin is a cross between sloe gin and a gin liqueur, and will make the most of a blackberry glut…

method.Step 1: Blitz the berries and 100g of the sugar in a food processor, then press through a metal sieve into a pan.

method.Step 2: Add the remaining sugar and cinnamon to the pan and cook over a medium heat, stirring to dissolve the sugar. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes, then stir in the alcohol. Remove from the heat and discard the cinnamon.

method.Step 3: Sterilise some bottles and lids, clean and upturn them – lids off – on a baking sheet. Put in the oven for 15 minutes. make sure that the bottles lie on their sides. Strain the gin into bottles, seal, label and chill.

method.Step 4: Shake before serving in shot glasses, diluted with sparkling water and ice or drizzled over ice cream.

title: Hot mulled winter punch
description: Make the party swing with this delicious mulled winter punch recipe, which is our take on traditional mulled wine.
ingredients: 1 bottle of red wine, such as claret
2 tbsp orange-flavoured liqueur, such as Grand Marnier or Cointreau

method.Step 1: Push 3 cloves into each strip of orange.

method.Step 2: Mix the clove-studded orange strips and all the other ingredients together in a large pan. Half fill the wine bottle with water and add to the pan or add 375ml water. Bring up to simmering point on the hob. Barely simmer for 15-20 minutes – do not let it boil or all the alcohol will evaporate. Serve in slightly warmed, heatproof cups or glasses.

title: Italian Champagne cocktail
description: Indulge guests with this celebratory cocktail recipe made with vodka, Campari and champagne.
ingredients: 1 tsp of sugar, golden if possible

method.Step 1: Pour 1 teaspoon of sugar into the bottom of a champagne flute and add 1 tablespoon of vodka and 1 tablespoon of Campari.

method.Step 2: Top up with chilled champagne and serve.

title: Hot Caribbean kiss cocktail
description: This warm Caribbean cocktail recipe is made with rum, raisins and Seville orange marmalade.
ingredients: 75ml good-quality aged golden rum (such as Havana Club)

method.Step 1: Heat rum with raisins, marmalade and demerara sugar in a saucepan until the marmalade dissolves.

method.Step 2: Pour into a wine glass, decorate with a strip of lemon and orange zest and serve.

title: Dubonnet royale cocktail
description: Having a retro party? A 1970s classic drink, Dubonnet is back in vogue, especially with the Queen’s Platinum Jubilee on the horizon in June 2022, as it’s thought to be a favourite drink of hers.
ingredients: champagne or sparkling dry white wine

method.Step 1: Put 30ml of Dubonnet into a flute and top up with champagne or sparkling dry white wine for a rich and spicy cocktail.

title: Warm cider punch
description: This recipe for warm cider punch has a touch of whiskey – making it a delicious variation on a classic. The perfect drink for a chilly evening, Halloween or a Bonfire Night hand warmer.

method.Step 1: Pour 100ml of Southern Comfort or bourbon into a jug. Add 4 crushed juniper berries, 4 cinnamon sticks, 1 cored and sliced rosy apple and a 660ml bottle of medium sweet cider.

method.Step 2: Microwave on high for 2 minutes to warm through.

method.Step 3: Take out the cinnamon sticks and put each one into a glass mug. Pour the cider punch into each mug. Serve with sticky rosemary sausages.
